doc:
Jeffrey Perry (British actor) https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jeffrey_Perry_(British_actor) 0 Jeffrey Harold Perry (13 October 1948 – 4 February 2012) was a British stage and screen actor. Born in Barrow-in-Furness, Lancashire and trained at the Guildhall School of Music and Drama, he worked extensively for the Royal Exchange in Manchester. He may be best known to television audiences as Mr. Tumnus in the 1988 version of The Lion, the Witch, and the Wardrobe, which was part of the BBC's Chronicles of Narnia TV miniseries. In the 2000s, Perry's work included performances at the Mill at Sonning. In the summer of 2008, he played Mr. Mole in Love's a Luxury. He was also a director of NOT The National Theatre and toured with them, appearing in several productions. Jeffrey_Harold_Perry ( 13_October_1948 – 4_February_2012 ) was a_British_stage_and_screen_actor . Born in Barrow-in-Furness , Lancashire and trained at the_Guildhall_School of Music_and_Drama , he worked extensively for the_Royal_Exchange in Manchester . He may_be_best_known to television_audiences as Mr._Tumnus in the_1988_version of The_Lion , the_Witch , and the_Wardrobe , which was part of the_BBC 's_Chronicles of Narnia_TV_miniseries . In the_2000s , Perry 's_work included performances at the_Mill at Sonning . In the_summer of 2008 , he played Mr._Mole in Love 's_a_Luxury . He was also a_director of NOT_The_National_Theatre and toured with them , appearing in several_productions .
